risks: Potential timing conflicts with other animations
Browser compatibility with CSS transition timing
Performance impact if animation timing is changed globally

detailed_analysis.root_cause: Timing mismatch between 300ms JavaScript setTimeout and 1s CSS transition, causing visual flicker when progress bars animate from undefined initial state

technical_details.current_flow: 1. Skills rendered with no initial width (0%) 2. IntersectionObserver triggers when visible 3. 300ms setTimeout before setting width 4. CSS 1s transition animates to target width
technical_details.issue_mechanism: Progress bars start with undefined/0% width, setTimeout creates delay before width is set, CSS transition then animates from current state causing backward movement and flicker
technical_details.data_structure: Skills data embedded in window.STATIC_DATA with level values 50-95% for different technologies

fix_approaches: Remove setTimeout delay and set initial width to 0% explicitly
Adjust CSS transition timing to match JavaScript timing
Use CSS animations instead of transitions for better control
Add proper initial state handling before triggering animations
testing_requirements: Test across different browsers for timing consistency
Test on mobile devices for touch scrolling

issue_title: Bug: Skills progress bars flicker and move backwards during animation
